structural_unit_name.en: Johan Skytte Institute of Political Studies

description.en: The course will examine both theoretical frameworks explaining the development of the third sector as well as more practical case-studies of how third sector organizations perform in relation to both the state and average citizens.
description.et: See kursus uurib nii kolmanda sektori arengut selgitavaid teoreetilisi käsitlusi kui ka praktilisi juhtumeiud sellest, kuidas kolmanda sektori organisatsioonid toimivad suhetes riigi ja tavakodanikega.

objectives.en: The third sector plays a critical role in both fulfilling the principles of democracy and contributing to modern governance. This course asks how the third sector operates in its different forms and how it markets itself to perform its varied functions.
objectives.et: Kolmas sektor mängib kriitilist rolli demokraatia põhimõtete ja hea valitsemise põhimõtete täitmisel. See kursus käsitleb seda, kuidas kolmas sektor toimib oma erinevates vormides ning turustab end täitma erinevaid funktsioone.

learning_outcomes.en: Upon completion of this course, students will:
- understand the place of the third sector in contemporary democracy and governance;
learning_outcomes.et: - mõistab kolmanda sektori kohta kaasaegses demokraatias ja valitsemises;

learning_outcomes.en: - identify and research the activities of third sector actors and organizations;
learning_outcomes.et: - on võimeline kindlaks määrama ja uurima kolmanda sektori toimijate ja organisatsioonide tegevusi;

learning_outcomes.en: - relate sub-fields of third sector research such as social entrepreneurship to broader issues of governance;
learning_outcomes.et: - suhestab kolmanda sektori uurimise ala-teemasid nagu nt sotsiaalne ettevõtlus laiemate hea valitsemise küsimustega;

learning_outcomes.en: - understand principles of participatory and direct democracy that arise through third sector activities.
learning_outcomes.et: - mõistab osalus- ja otsedemokraatia põhimõtteid, mis tõusetuvad kolmanda sektori tegevustest.

notes.et: More detailed information about the course, all study materials and assignments' instructions will be available in Moodle.

independent_work.et:
Students will need to complete: 

1) Short assignments during the lecture time
2) Mid-term test 
3) Case-study report and presentation in groups
4) Seminar work 
Instructions for completion of the assignments will be explained during lectures and in Moodle.

description.et: 10 short assignments during the lectures (each of them is worth max 2 points). In total, maximum 20 points can be collected.
Mid-term test is maximum 20 points (the test will be either in Moodle or on paper, the format will be announced in advance).

Case-study reports and presentations are worth maximum 35 points including 25 points for the report and 10 points for the presentation of case-study results during practical sessions (week 39). Detailed instructions for the case-study will be provided in Moodle.

Seminar work - maximum 25 points: including max 16 points for presentation and 9 points for participation (attending and actively participating in each of 3 seminars is worth 3 points). The topics for seminars will be available for registration in Moodle.

Final test for those students who will not collect 60 points during the course by completing various assignments described above. Minimum 70% of correct answers of the final test is the requirement to pass the course.

grade_evaluation.et: To pass the course, students are required to collect at least 60 points during the course work. In case 60-point threshold is not reached, it will be required to write a final test with minimum 70% of correct answers for 'pass' result.

debt_elimination.et: According to the course schedule (2 dates for your choice to write the final test and one date for resit). NB! This is relevant only for students who will not collect required points during the course.

resources.mandatory_materials: All readings and recorded lectures will be available in Moodle.
